message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CE

The paper deals with the evaluation of the impact of cognition in a downlink cellular system with multiple relays, which involves transmission schemes, rate-splitting, superposition coding, and interference decoding. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. Additionally, the paper focuses on the practical design example for a network with two relay nodes and three receivers, which involves evaluating the impact of relay cognition and characterizing the trade-offs between energy consumption and rate improvements. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) and Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-categories. Furthermore, the paper presents a numerical simulation setup to automate the derivation of achievable rate regions for a general relay-assisted downlink cellular network, which involves considering a large number of transmission strategies for different levels of relay cognition. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) and Computer Engineering (cs.CE) sub-categories.
